europeana:record.dc:title: A rectification in the genus Apriona
Zoologische Mededelingen
europeana:record.dc:creator: Jong, de C.
europeana:record.dc:subject: Insecta
europeana:record.dc:description: Some time ago when examining some Batocerini (Cerambycidae, Lamiinae) I was struck by the strange pattern of Apriona fasciata Rits. (cf. Ritsema, Notes Leyden Mus., vol. 20, 1898, p. 87) of which species our Museum possesses a single female specimen, the unique type (fig. 1). Especially the "five naked transverse bands" puzzled me because no indication of such a zebra-pattern is found in any other known species of the genus Apriona. Examining the specimen very carefully I found out that these transverse bands were artificially produced by removing the yellowish scales from the elytra with a sharp object the marks of which are clearly seen under the microscope. This proves
europeana:record.dcterms:isPartOf: A rectification in the genus Apriona (URN:ISSN:0024-0672) (Volume 18) (Issue 14)
